intro: Atractylis mernephthae, commonly known as the Egyptian burrgrass, is a flowering plant native to Egypt. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough leaves and spiny seed heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in dense heads, and it produces elongated, barbed seeds that aid in wind dispersal. Atractylis mernephthae is often found in disturbed areas and along roadsides in its native habitat.
